definition: to rack one's brains
to twist (strands into a thread)/to entangle/to wring/to hang (by the neck)/to turn/to wind/classifier for skeins of yarn
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
brain/mind/head/essence
juice

sentences.english: I think brainbarfing is a more natural way to come up with writing material.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲絞盡腦汁是一種採集寫作素材更自然的方法。

sentences.english: B: They have racked their brain.
He tussled all night with the figures, but couldn't balance the account.
sentences.chinese: 他絞盡腦汁算了一夜也沒把帳算清。

sentences.english: The students there were working hard. They rack their brains tackling difficult scientific problems.
sentences.chinese: 學生在那兒苦讀，絞盡腦汁地解決科學難題。

sentences.english: But don't agonize over what to write.
sentences.chinese: 但是，不要絞盡腦汁來想到底寫什麼。

sentences.english: Even after racking his brains he couldn't think of a single example.
sentences.chinese: 即便絞盡腦汁，他還是連一個例女也念不出來。

sentences.english: Is it worthwhile to cudgel your brains to find a solution to that puzzle on the newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你這樣絞盡腦汁去解決報上的那個智力測驗題值得嗎？

sentences.english: Are you looking for ways to make quick cash?
sentences.chinese: 你在爲如何賺快錢而絞盡腦汁？

sentences.english: The scientist has worried at the problem during the last two months.
sentences.chinese: 科學工作者在過去的兩個月裏絞盡腦汁攻克難題。

sentences.english: Both directors and performers rack their brains during writing and rehearsals.
sentences.chinese: 導演和演員們絞盡腦汁地進行節目的編排。

sentences.english: No guts, but this writing is also racked their brains.
sentences.chinese: 沒有膽量，而且寫稿時也是絞盡腦汁。

sentences.english: You are at your wits' end and have begun to dread meal times.
sentences.chinese: 你爲此絞盡腦汁並且開始害怕喫飯時間的到來。

sentences.english: She wrack her brains to solve that complicated problem.
sentences.chinese: 她絞盡腦汁在想解決這個複雜問題。

sentences.english: He puzzled his brains to find the answer to the physics problem.
sentences.chinese: 他絞盡腦汁尋求這道物理題的答案。

sentences.english: Mary was rack her brain for the key to the problem during the exam.
sentences.chinese: 馬麗在考試時絞盡腦汁尋找答案。

definition: to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
accustomed to/used to
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to boast
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
stupefied/flabbergasted
mature reflection/after careful deliberations
careless/reckless/casually/absent-mindedly/at will/at random/any old how
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
